title: Monster Hunter Wiki | Weapon Trees
description: Easily view and navigate the complex weapon trees of Japanese versions of Monster Hunter and Monster Hunter G.
head: <link rel='stylesheet' href='css/weapons.css'/><script type='text/javascript' src='js/toggle_full_details.js'></script><script type='text/javascript' src='js/weapon_data.js'></script><script type='text/javascript' src='js/weapons.js'></script>
subtitle: Names adjusted based on best guesses from the Gamefaqs MH1 weapon trees and MHF1 wiki weapons pages. Some weapons may not be obtainable through normal play. Most prices are for forging; a price in parentheses is the cost to buy.

tbody.bodyClass: dragonsword branch indent-1 g-rank mhg dragon-pre
branch rathalos-fireswords g-rank indent-1 fire-pre-g dragon-pre-g

hammers.class: high-rank mhg fire-pre dragon-pre poison-pre paralysis-pre

lances.class: high-rank mhg fire-pre-g water-pre-g dragon-pre-g poison-pre-g paralysis-pre-g

weapons.rowTitle: Can also be downgraded back to the Legendary Sword
weapons.name: Eternal Strife*

swords.class: high-rank mhg water-pre thunder-pre dragon-pre poison-pre sleep-pre

hammer.name: Spin 1
inputs: R1 (full charge while moving, first hit)

hammer.name: Spin 2
inputs: R1 (full charge while moving, hits 2 through 5)

hammer.name: Golf Swing Finisher
inputs: R Stick (during third or fourth spin)

dualSwords.name: Demon Rolling Slice
inputs: R Stick (after dodge rolling, demon mode)
